channel.title: Frankenstein on The Amateur Data Scientist
channel.description: Recent content in Frankenstein on The Amateur Data Scientist

item.title: Hideous Progeny: Tidytext Analysis of Frankenstein
item.description: The Moden Prometheus Pursuit for Frankenstein Begins Emptiness Filled Destruction and Creation Of Man, Of Life A Big Ending Uncontrollable Feelings Waves of Emotions Down the Precipice Fear the Daemon Ice and Hearts of Fire And now, once again, I bid my hideous progeny go forth and prosper. — Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley (London, 15 October 1831) The Moden Prometheus Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley’s Frankenstein (The Modern Prometheus) is one of the best stories anyone can read.
